item.title: Report E-2024080563
item.description:
Report E-2024080563

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 14, 2204, one (1) 55-pound bag of sodium hydroxide was punctured and released approximately five (5) pounds to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools to collect the released material. All waste and the damaged bag were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024080565
item.description:
Report E-2024080565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 14, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed a neutralizing agent, then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN2922 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080539
item.description:
Report E-2024080539

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: PECATONICA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1330ct we received a call from the driver that there was liquid drippings from the rear of the trailer. They put the trailer into containment and put down some absorbents to collect the material. The response team was called and showed up at 1545ct to begin the clean-up. the team dawned the proper PPE and began and found that the bottom of the drum had a small hole due to the drum was rusted. The crew then proceeded to place the damaged drum into a salvage drum and the material was cleaned up and the absorbent were disposed of in the proper manner. The clean up was completed at 1800ct.

item.title: Report X-2024081503
item.description:
Report X-2024081503

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX IS MARKED THIS SIDE UP, PERISHABLE, AND FREEZE OR REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024080504
item.description:
Report E-2024080504

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail that impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waster was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080503
item.description:
Report E-2024080503

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: USPS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS. OUTER PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE USPS PRIORITY MAIL BOX THAT HAS BEEN PARTIALLY DESTROYED WITH SEVERAL AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYWAY GLASS CLEANER SPILLING OUT OF THE BOX. IT APPEARS THE CAPS OF ONE OR MORE OF THE AEROSOL CANS HAD COME OFF EXPOSING AND ENGAGING THE NOZZLE RELEASING THE PRODUCT INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE BEGAN TO DETERIORATE AND ULTIMATELY BROKE OPEN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER USPS BOX TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE TRAILERED INTO THE UPS ROCKFORD FACLITY AND WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING PRIOR TO FLIGHT ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

OUTER PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE USPS PRIORITY MAIL BOX THAT HAS BEEN PARTIALLY DESTROYED WITH FOUR AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYWAY GLASS CLEANER SPILLING OUT OF THE BOX. IT APPEARS ONE OR MORE OF THE AEROSOL CANS LEAKED CAUSING THE BOX TO DETERIORATE AND BREAK OPEN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THER OUTER USPS BOX TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE TRAILERED INTO THE UPS FACLITY AND WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING PRIOR TO FLIGHT ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND A WET HAZMAT PLACED ON THE DMP TABLE. RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE (BAGGS) AND BROUGHT DECISION TREE AND SPILL CART SUPPLIES. THE BOX WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID AND OPENED THE BOX TO SEE IT WAS A METAL BUCKET THAT HAD SLIGHTLY LEAKED BECAUSE IT WAS DENTED.

item.title: Report I-2024070103
item.description:
Report I-2024070103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LEMONT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer was loaded at Rowell in Willow Springs on 06/20/2024 with hydrochloric acid 28% and parked for the next day's delivery. On 6/21/2024, driver went to make delivery to customer in University Park, IL. Driver could not get valves to open due to an issue with the air switches not fully opening the internal valve. This is when the trailer was brought to B&R for repairs. When the driver arrived at B&R he stopped and went into the office to check the trailer in, he came out and found HCL leaking from the pump cabinet onto the ground. Driver immediately went to seek out the source of the leak he found it to be leaking from a flange in the piping from the internal valve to the pump. He stopped the leak and began the neutralization process and reported it the repair shop. The repair shop helped the driver to neutralize the spill and clean it up. Driver estimated 5-8 gallons of hydrochloric acid 28% was lost. Trailer's leak was stopped, and the trailer was brought to a contained area to be pumped out. Once the trailer was emptied it was washed out and brought in for necessary repairs. It was found the secondary and internal valve failed. It was also found the flange gasket from the internal to the pump was the incorrect material.

item.description:
